newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Jakarta stocks close lower as blue chips fall.
newsitem.headline: Jakarta stocks close lower as blue chips fall.

text.p: Jakarta share prices closed lower on Monday, pulled down by profiting taking in several blue chips despite active buying in some secondaries, broker said.
The Jakarta Composite Index eased 0.47 points, or 0.07 percent, to close at 696.03 points. Gainers led losers by 73 to 53, with 64 counters unchanged.
Total turnover was 589.4 billion rupiah on a volume of 238.17 million shares which also boosted by cross-trading transactions.
Telecommunications firm Telkom was cross-traded at 4,100 rupiah on a volume of 30 million shares and glass-maker Mulia Industrindo cross-trade at 2,975 rupiah on 13.5 million shares.
The new LQ45 index launched on Monday was off 0.149 points, or 0.10 percent, to 147.07 points after opening at 147.218.
It includes stocks that are of high market liquidity and value and the 45 companies included in the index represent about 80 percent of total market capitalisation on the Jakarta bourse.
The exchange said the index had been calculated from a base of 100 on July 13, 1994.
Brokers said the market focus on Tuesday would likely remain on second-liners with active locally-driven buying.
"Market speculations that some companies have been targeted for either take-overs or a link-up is likely to continue boosting sentiment in certain issues," a broker said.
She referred to Hero supermarket, retailer Multipolar and shoe maker Ganda Wangsa.

Brokers said supermarket Hero was also active on intense speculation that the firm had been targeted by the Lippo Group for a possible take-over or link-up despite denials from executives of both companies.
Hero rose 100 rupiah to 2,575 rupiah on 5.2 million shares.
The news also boosted sentiment toward retailer Multipolar, a unit of the Lippo Group, which rose 125 rupiah to close at 2,475 rupiah on 5.9 million shares traded, brokers said.

They said the rise in Multipolar was also linked to recent news that Matahari founder Hari Darmawan was planning to take a stake in the firm after Multipolar took a 50.1 controlling interest in Matahari.

Shoe maker Ganda Wangsa Utama was the most active stock with 19.2 million shares changing hand, rising 100 rupiah to close at 1,225 rupiah amid speculation over the agenda for a shareholders' meeting due on March 24.
One broker said there was market speculation the company might get new investors coupled with talks of a possible rights issue, stock split and bonus shares.
Company officials were not available for comment.
Brokers said continued profit-taking in blue chips such as Indosat and Sampoerna on Tuesday would put a cap on the index.
Telecommunications service provider Indosat fell 1.06 percent to close at 6,975 rupiah on 522,500 shares in line with its Friday closing price in New York of $29.
Cigarette maker Sampoerna fell 150 rupiah to 14,000 rupiah on a volume of 317,000 shares on what brokers said was profit-taking.
